alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 12 at 1:44PM MDT until June 12 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Elbert County in east central Colorado... * Until 445 PM MDT. * At 144 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Simla and Cedar Point. This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaver Creek, Water Gulch, East Bijou Creek, Middle Bijou Creek, Spring Branch, Wilson Creek, Agate Creek, Big Sandy Creek, Key Creek, West Bijou Creek, Antelope Creek and Reed Springs Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Excessive runoff from these storm will cause flash flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
